What is the purpose of deprioritizing the mining process when using Verus for pool-mining on Linux?

Deprioritizing the mining process allows the miner to throttle down when the PC needs processing power for other applications, preventing interference with other processes running on the PC. This method has been reported to enable the use of CPU-heavy applications, like games, without the miner interfering.

Why is it not recommended to use the Verus wallet (GUI and CLI) for a solo-mining setup?
The Verus wallet (GUI and CLI) does more than just mining, so it's not suitable for a solo-mining setup. It's recommended to use pool-mining software specifically designed for mining.

How do I adjust the batch file to run my NHEQMINER on low priority?

To run NHEQMINER on low priority, you need to add `nice -n 19` before the command you normally use. For example: `nice -n 19./nheqminer -v -l pool.verus.io:9999 -u RVjvbZuqSGLGDm1B9BFkbHWySPKEx4tfjQ.Donator -p x -t 6`. Make sure to replace the pool and address with your preferred pool and mining address.
